block.p: UNIVERSAL DISPLAY, Ewing, N.J., a developer of flat-panel displays, was named the prime contractor of a $1 million contract from the Department of Defense to make flexible, lightweight display materials.

LUCENT TECHNOLOGIES, Murray Hill, N.J., the maker of phone equipment, said it would invest $110 million and add 250 workers to increase production at its optical fiber plant in Brondby, Denmark.

RAILAMERICA, Boca Raton, Fla., the largest holder of regional railroads in the United States, said it would sell as many as 10 small rail properties and other assets as part of a plan to reduce debt by more than $100 million.

AVENTIS, France's largest drug maker, said it would shut its Virogenetics vaccine-research laboratory in Troy, N.Y., because the cost of operating the 26-worker site had become too high. The Virogenetics research will be moved to the Aventis Pasteur laboratory in Toronto.
